qas.question: Can i fly from the uk to china?

answers.text: The Chinese authorities have suspended all direct flights from the UK.

qas.question: Do i need a visa to go to china from the uk?

answers.text: You will need a valid visa to enter China

qas.question: Where can i apply for a chinese visa in the uk?

paragraphs.context: You will need a valid visa to enter China. The Chinese Visa Application Centres in London, Manchester and Edinburgh are operating but with limited opening hours. The Application Centre in Belfast remains closed. The Chinese authorities have suspended all direct flights from the UK. This measure will be subject to review but no date has been announced. Restrictions on travel to China from other countries, and the necessary requirements, may be different. British nationals travelling to China from a third country should follow the directions on the website of the local Chinese Embassy or consulate for requirements from that country. On 4 November 2020 the Chinese Embassy in the UK announced the temporary suspension of entry into China by non-Chinese nationals in the UK holding Chinese visas or residence permits valid at the time of the announcement.

qas.question: Can i use an nhs test to enter china?

answers.text: You should not use the NHS testing service to get a test in order to facilitate your travel to another country

qas.question: How many flights are running from europe to shanghai?

answers.text: A small number of international flights are also operating direct between European cities and Shanghai

paragraphs.context:
You should not use the NHS testing service to get a test in order to facilitate your travel to another country. You should arrange to take a private test from one of the eligible providers.
\nA limited number of international flights from other countries are flying into Beijing. Other international passenger flights to Beijing continue to be diverted to 16 designated airports in Chengdu, Changsha, Hefei, Lanzhou, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang, Taiyuan, Hohhot, Jinan, Qingdao, Nanjing, Shenyang, Dalian, Zhengzhou, Xi\u2019an and Wuhan. A small number of international flights are also operating direct between European cities and Shanghai, Guangzhou and Qingdao.
